Z8mOsNQCjySzJhgvqjUbEg.text: I usually order takeout from here. The Sugar Creek location. The fried chicken is the best I have had in Charlotte. I also had the Mac and cheese and the broccoli casserole was equally flavorful. I have been at least 3 times and each time the food is great.

xTna8qxCyv-0nkZQ4jKlCg.text: Wait 30 after calling in my order 30 prior to showing up. They fried the chicken and okra in burnt grease. On top of that my kids got food poisoning from this dump. OSHA needs to shut this cess pool down.

VcNvNx3x7yPB-kqbHJtXCA.text: Delicious!!! The fried chicken is excellent!!! I love their potato salad and macaroni and cheese. Ive never been disappointed!!!

-Ha0v4zssyvfjA1fc_QEtA.text: The quality of the food has changed. I started eating here almost two years ago and it was really good. The mac & cheese has changed a lot. The baked chicken is always over cooked and the collard greens are filled with stalks. The service never comes by to give you any refills and when you call him (Tommy), he acts like you're bothering him to get you something. My husband always orders the fries pork chops and they never bring him a knife. When he ask for one they always bring a butter knife. We started keeping a steak knife in the car and bringing it in when we eat there. Today we noticed that they are doing a lot of construction, painting and moving furniture....so we will not be returning.

gdxmaWDVJ83V3S0UE_iNtw.text: My cousin and I were cruising by one afternoon and had to check out The Chicken Box. It was our first visit to a place neither of us had ever heard of, so we had no idea what to expect. When we walked in and saw the menu, I was shocked...it was huge!  More soul food selections then you could imagine. I'm always a bit skeptical about new places though, so I went with a favorite of mine, fried chicken.   Now, you may think I'm pulling your leg here, but I kid you not. This place had the BEST fried chicken I've ever tasted! I had the broccoli casserole and mac and cheese as my sides. Never tasted better sides. Even the sweet tea was just purely wonderful. The lady that took our order was as sweet as the tea, couldn't ask for better service. She recommended the sweet potato pie for desert, which was great as well.  I would highly recommend The Chicken Box to anyone looking for some truly great soul food. This little joint gets 5 stars from me, and I will make sure to stop in again for some more great food.

R8XlsA1IqsPLykFcW4B4yg.text: They have expanded! I didn't even know.  This location is so much bigger than the last one. Pleasant, fast service.  All the food was hot and home cooked. I was pleasantly surprised. Its a little limited but its cheap and you get a ton of food.

c_0YpJHqjoZOKTUqsweL-g.text: I must say, on my most recent trip to the Chicken Box (second location), I was quite disappointed. I don't know if they were having a bad day, or if it was just me. I was in the mood for fish so I ordered the whiting dinner. It's usually pretty good. On this particular day, the fish was really thin and a little on the tough side. Can white fish be tough? lol I had fried okra ( my fav!) for my side and the taste was just way off! I'm going to blame it on bad greese. Any other time I never have a bad meal at either locations. Not the best soul food in town, but pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Whiting dinner. Double the okra for me!
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. A good ol&#39; fried dinner!

3XJShcVm6Jqta76CL3OitA.text: This must be our fourth or fifth time we have had The Chicken Box cater an affair and they never disappoint.  This time we ordered 60 pieces of fried chicken. All pieces were done perfectly, crispy and seasoned well. Our guests were impressed with the fried chicken.  Just a side note-this past summer, we had Chicken Box cater our family reunion banquet. This was a great meal, with great sides. They raved over the mac and cheese and green beans.  So far, we have been very happy with their catering as well as the occasional meal while out and about. Would most definitely recommend The Chicken Box.

8INwx4jS5_5HB0EhoZWaPA.text: Came into town from Raleigh with my mom a few weeks back and we decided to eat here. We saw commercials for this place all the way in Raleigh. I must say the food was really good with just the right amount of seasonings. I ordered the baked chicken white/stuffing, collards, mac & cheese. Lets not forget the sweet tea and roll. This was excellent and my mom ordered the same thing with a side of sweet potatoes. If you're  ever in town you must try this place out.

3qSZFqYnqZwmBPx5tInJFg.text: Ok, my girlfriend and I drove all the way from hickory just to eat here and I will say that the chicken box did not disappoint us. I had the 4 wing dinner with collards and okra and she had the oxtails with rice,  collards and okra. We enjoyed our meals and left full and satisfied.  I will say that the chicken wings, in my opinion was average but the oxtails was the highlight of the dinner. Overall I rate this place 4 stars for service, sides and those delicious oxtails.

IxHPX7g3FtCbGWjyszEhuw.text: I've eaten here several times before.  It seems like its always hit or miss.  This time was a BIG miss!  I had the meatloaf, Mac & cheese, and stuffing.  The Mac & cheese was so dry and very bland.  The stuffing was burnt and it wasn't edible.  The meatloaf was just ok.  It also took 20 minutes to get my food which seems it could have been sitting out for a while.  I really want to love this place.  But, today reminded me why I only go 2-3 times a year.  I remember the 1 amazing meal I had and I somehow always hope I get that experience again.  All and all, I'd rather eat at Lola's uptown.  The food is much better and the people seem friendlier.

xfPcpxlSB_UOG0irijStMw.text: Love the chicken gizards and livers. Chicken, Greens and cabbage are good.

KY63bvRb02-gPiqKW3K0Ig.text: Today for lunch I decided to try this place based on my boyfriend's suggestion that the food was fantastic, however I was slightly disappointed... I ordered the Perch dinner with macaroni and cheese and green beans with a corn muffin for my sides. For starters I didn't like the fact that this place charges .29 cents for tap water. The green beans were bland to me they tasted like canned green beans!!!! The Mac and cheese was just okay not bad or good and the perch was okay as well. The only great thing about the place was the workers friendly attitude. But here's my verdict lets just say that my boyfriend is suspended for choosing places to eat for a while....      :)

1noih6xxHNh4I3nSmWbQQw.text: A friend of mine who lives in Charlotte took me here and I definitely enjoyed the experience. Great fried chicken and the sides were excellent as well. The greens were great.

1P43J1Ia6pHkcMK7ujwhsg.text: I have yet to have a great experience from this Chicken Box on Sugar creek. (I grew up eating the one on North Tryon with the same owners).  My mother gave me the warning not to eat the one on Sugar creek but to continue going to the North Tryon location. Once the locations were combined to the Sugar Creek location, I decided it couldn't be THAT bad anymore. I was wrong. I ordered my usual, Bbq chicken white meat, broccoli casserole , Mac and cheese, and I add a side of rice and gravy. I called it in and sent my boyfriend to pick it up. Once he got home he assured me the employee checked the bag for all the contents. When we finally open every thing we were missing 2 sides (My Favorite two sides! ). Once I finally cooled down, I began eating the chicken and it was awful, looked like they just slapped Bbq onto baked chicken (It used to look like it had been stewing for hours, The meat would fall off the bone) . It's safe to say I will never be back. To think I was in love with this place and spoke so highly of it!

dB-7CwiVR6wQEBMqIC1dvg.text: Decided to pick up dinner for the family tonight and I thought the Chicken Box would be satisfying. I appreciated the owner giving me a breast after learning the 4 piece chicken dinner I ordered were just too small. But the chicken was over cooked and i was so disappointed.  My daughter ordered the fish with yams and mac and cheese and enjoyed both. I was really disappointed in the wing selection. Because I have faith in this establishment, I'll try it again.

wp6jhxq-mday5wFBmC1hXA.text: This place had the most horrible customer service and food service times in the world!!! If you like to wait up to 45 minutes for ONE dinner plate and enjoy looking at the nonchalant face of the cashier who looks like she hates being there, then by all means, enjoy!  I have called to place an order before hand numerous times and every single time I come to pick it up ( I live 5 min away) it is never ready or even close to being ready. It takes me 15 minutes just pay for my preordered meal. Then when they take my money it takes an additional 30 min to actually receive the dinner.  I try going at different time throughout the day thinking that I might have missed the lunch rush and will hopefully receive my meal a little quicker. WRONG!! Same thing just minus about 10 min from your initial wait time. The sad part that they actually have good food!! That's why for some strange reason I keep coming back ( not to mention it's so close to my house). The last 3 times I went to order food, I couldn't wait 30 minutes for food and was pretty much forced to leave by choice. I gave them 2 stars because their food is good but everything else sucks.

Etcaa9DMRRbS2A24TG52gA.text: I have visited twice in two months. On my first visit my friend and I ordered Smothered Pork Chops,  Fried Chicken, Gizzards, Mac & Cheese and Cabbage. Smothered Porks were good, Mac & Cheese bad and everything else was just ok. Second visit Smothered Pork Chops, Mac & Cheese & Broccoli Casserole. This time EVERYTHING was bad. Gravy was dark, pork chops VERY dry, Mac & Cheese was even dry. Seemed like it had possibly been sitting for a while. Service is nothing to rave about. Needless to say I will not try this place again or recommend it.

TpQxmnIKP9kPIkHh9s04Fg.text: We could not have found a better place for Sunday dinner than Chicken Box.  We arrived about noon and there were a lot of people having dinner after church.  You order at the counter from the bewildering array of side order items.  It was really hard to narrow it down.  Ms T and I ordered a two piece and three piece dark dinner respectively with fried okra, black eyed peas, cole slaw, pintos and collards.  We chose corn bread muffins as our bread.  Wow, I'm getting hungry thinking about it and I just ate.  The chicken was very hot, fresh and juicy.  The salt was just right.  The coating was light, crisp and tender.  This is very good straight ahead fried chicken.  It is not peppery, either red or black.  The sides were all good.  Pintos were plain, perfectly cooked, perfect salt, one of my favorite things.  The greens had no meat or fat, in fact they have a little sign saying that they do not use pork fat/lard in their cooking, so I guess these greens are pretty healthful.  They were mild and flavorful, with perfect salt again.  The slaw was a fine Carolina chop with a very good creamy dressing that was slightly but not too sweet with good depth.  Black-eyed peas were similar to the pintos, plain, no meat, but flavorful and tender.  Ms T did not like the fried okra as well as she usually does.  I will have to yield to her expertise, put I liked it.  She felt it had been parboiled before frying, leaving it a little soggy.  It had mild but nice okra flavor coming through the light coating.  The corn muffins had good corn flavor.  This was a great meal of southern cookin'.  Again, we have found a place that is exactly what Sweetie Pie's in St Louis has the reputation for, but has completely failed to earn.  I have no idea when I will ever be in Charlotte again, but I would not say never.  When I am, I will eat at Chicken Box.  Might have to try the other location.  Strong four stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Just a little sample of what we should be having right now.

Xf7MOTe_q62oEEQMrapKfw.text: The only place I look forward to traveling to the Charlotte area for. Neck bones, chitterlings, fried chicken, oh my! All cooked with southern love.

KBs-g9_OExohNC5AsgigSg.text: The food was good, really good even. 3.5-4 stars for the food.  But the kitchen was awful. The food took forever to arrive, they brought out the wrong plates multiple times, and they completely forgot a side of fries our party ordered. When we brought it up, they said they would be right out. But they still weren't out by the time we finished the rest of our meal. The waitress actually told us it was because they were holding fries back for a large takeout order. On the one hand, I applaud her honesty I guess, but how about serving all your customers equally? We ended up getting it taken off the ticket.  So, if you're willing to put up with a terrible dining experience, you can get a good meal at a good price.  Maybe the moral of the story here is get it to go, apparently they'll prioritize you, lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Tenders with candied yams &amp; mac n&#39; cheese

YJtM6wc2-tX8KK0IsmfG-A.text: Here's the run down: -Customer service SUCKS! The staff gave me that grumpy old men feel  -Chicken was salllty! Omg  -Dressing tasted like it came from a TV dinner  -Yams...I was rooting for you!!! We were all rooting for you! You failed. The yams were hmmm...they were so bad I can't even find the words. Hard and old, just UGH -Mac n Cheese was a joke! Is that Kraft singles I taste??  -Whiting...blah.  I will neeeeevvvver go back.

WNMsmRpFzXrut5FKQjRl9Q.text: Easy access from I85. I stopped in because of a friend's recommendation. The free sweet tea at Yelp check-in was a good deal too.  Best part of the meal were the extra crispy chicken wings. The collards were a bit salty, but delicious.  The mac and cheese was too sweet for my taste,  but it was baked fresh.   I walked in today and there were over a dozen watermelons on the floor. It kind of added to the low frills ambiance.    The staff was nice and the food service was very quick.

dBhNXvfsTlTX_vs1x0feSw.text: Wow This place has really changed. I have live in the university area for quite a while now and have seen this place change over the years and I am sad to say I am disappointed. The food was terrible, cold, and they got my moms order wrong. The dining area was extremely cold and the tables were not clean and the tv was too loud. Needless to say I will not be back.

Ah4X4ErQQSVsslxwuVoyzw.text: The only bad thing I can say is that Chicken Box is an 1.5 hour drive from my home.  But, it gives me a reason to come back to Charlotte.  I have not had fried chicken this good in more years than I can remember.  The batter was light crunchy batter encapsulated the moist flavor chicken.  What an explosion of goodness with every bite.  Very low key restaurant that allows their food to speak volumes.    I truly enjoyed my meal as did my wife and son.  This is now our goto chicken place every time we are in or near Charlotte!!!!  A definite family and friend recommendation as well as a repeater!!!!  If you are in Charlotte, even passing through along I85, you need to swing in.

BE6qH6qegNnZiB7cK_fzvg.text: Excellent fried chicken (reminds me of how my mom used to make it) and amazing greens!    When I'm in Charlotte on business and want some "home cooking", it's the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

KKuQu7zvvehvYwf2O_74IQ.text: This is thee worst soul food that I've ever tasted.  The first sip of sweet tea was a red flag. Iced tea, yes; sweet tea--absolutely not!  The food is ridiculously bland--salt n' pepper are not in their repertoire.   We ordered a meatloaf meal, and a whiting meal, and my daughter's father, a very un-picky eater left more than 3/4's of his meatloaf meal!  The cheese was totally absent from the mac n' cheese. In fact, it should be called mac n' cream. What really peeved me was that I decided to treat today and 2 terrible meals, a slice of sweet potato pie (that baby daddy is afraid to eat) and 2 terrible drinks totaled $28, not included the $2 take-out tip I gave them.  I want a refund!  Honestly, the best part of the meal was the candied yams (decent), the cornbread muffin, and biscuit. Please hire new cooks.  I gave the 1 star for the guy behind the counter. He seemed cool.

JsT4lJsrx2Pkpi-ksqI01g.text: So i have heard some pretty good thing about this place so i decided to give it a try one day.  The restaurant was very dirty inside which kind of makes it hard to enjoy a meal. I got fried chicken with mac n cheese and fries. The chicken was extremely salty to the point where i couldnt even eat it. The fries tasted like they had been cooked in the same fry bin as fish which made them pretty hard to eat as well. As for the mac n cheese it was bland and not to my liking. On the upside the service was very good, but i can guarantee i wont be back.

7Q6fL7bucNDLELDZNqUpKw.text: Horrible food. Save yourself the disappointment and find another place to eat. The candied yams were over cooked, the green beans were sweet, the macaroni and cheese was bland and runny, and the chicken was undercooked, It was still pink inside and had a weird smell. I came hungry and left hungry... Couldn't finish anything.

slaOtAXV2fUlAycFUd07xQ.text: I love the original Chicken Box on N. Tryon but I decided to stop here because it was closer. I called ahead and spoke with a nice lady on the phone to order a 3pc whiting with cabbage, cornbread and black eyed peas. I told her about the offer on yelp for a free sweet tea with entree purchase and she asked that I just bring it with me and I would be fine.  When I arrived the man at the register was in the back and came out complaining about another employee. He said to a client waiting for her order, "You see what I have to deal with!?"  He and that client proceeded to have an exchange about the other employee's "attitude" while 3 other clients awaited his service. Needless to say, the lady in front of me (who was next in line) was displaying perturbed body language, which he completely disregarded.  When it was my turn, he asked for my order and I stated that I'd already called in for a pick up order. Instead of asking for my name and looking it up in their system, he proceeded to play a guessing game, that took about a minute and a half. Finally, he asked my name and said it should be out shortly. I informed him of the yelp coupon (that's available with check in) for the sweet tea. He condescendingly stated, "Ya'll be usin' these old coupons! Here's the coupon we got right now." He then passed me a folded copy of the menu (yeah,the menu!). I explained him that I was confident it was valid as it was on the yelp page and was only available with check-in. He angrily went and got the tea and told me my total was $8.45. When I pulled out my card he said, "That will be $9.45."  I explained to him that he'd just given me a different total and he said that was because of the tax. At this point, I didn't want to argue over the dollar.   When he brought me my order he complained about the bag, clearly trying to blame the other employee. He got a new bag. I checked my order and started to leave. He said, "We good?", instead of offering a genuine apology. At which point, I just walked off.   Now on to the food...  The whiting was hot and delicious.  The cabbage tasted like it had been sitting for days and had a light brown tint versus the typical green color. It had a strange aftertaste.  The black eyes peas tasted like they'd been sitting as well and were bland and watery. The cornbread muffin was dry and lackluster.  The tea was perfectly sweetened.   The one on N. Tryon is always a perfect experience and I'll keep going there as I have been since the 1990s.   Avoid this location and drive the extra 5 miles for a fabulous experience.

3fIlhItKVFXix7iBOBj0Nw.text: I guess a restaurant is doing pretty good if they open a second location.  The Chicken Box 2 is beside the Cookout on Sugar Creek, and I must say its a nice size location, I think it's an old Shoney's or something but it's very roomy for those dining in.  They have the same menu and are open 7 days a week and have added a tasty looking breakfast menu that includes chicken and waffles(mental note to try as my eyes widened), pancakes, omelette's, platters, sandwiches, etc.  I may go as far to say that I thought the food was better compared to the Tryon street location, but I'll have to confirm that on my next trip.  I'm looking forward to going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

PRjJlfeOo4eP6kyNMqjfWA.text: Great food and service! We brought our AAU basketball team here. They took very good care of us! Definitely recommend this venue.

UpEUaH02oLyuWMgJJZYfaQ.text: Very disappointed! I chose the meal deal for $5.99 and it came with one smothered pork chop a side of rice and gravy and a roll. The portion size was horrible. It was about a half cup rice and the pork chop was very tiny!( the roll was almost bigger) The gravy was so bland and the temperature was luke warm. This was my second time visiting and not being happy. You can get better tasting and a larger quantity of  food at other restaurants nearby...I will not be returning!

l9LX6Pmit4FTm5fKN_uQww.text: I used to eat at the other location at least several times per week thru out the eighties and nineties since we had a retail business right next door on Tryon Street. We sold that business many years ago and I haven't had the great fried gizzards, livers, and chicken for quite a while now.  For several years now I've been meaning to stop by the new location on Sugaw Creek and finally did on Tuesday, 7/8/14, craving gizzards. It was 11 am and they had just opened for the day.  To my disappointment their food truck hadn't arrived yet and they were out of gizzards. I overheard another customers' conversation and I believe he had ordered fish, croakers I think, and they were out of that too. I believe a restaurant should never run out of their products they sell.  But anyway, I got an 8 piece order of chicken and an order of livers since they were out of gizzards and away I went. I couldn't wait to get home so I started in on the livers as soon as I got in the car. The first thing I noticed the oil used to fry the food appeared old. That's another no-no for a restaurant that specializes in fried food. Got'a keep that grease fresh! The next thing I noticed - NO SALT! The crust on the chicken and livers was excellent - except the lack of salt! Maybe they just forgot to add it to the breading mixture.  Any restaurant  can have a bad day and I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. Will I go back? Absolutely - next week!

OjM83eI4p1gtrp9YzI2A2Q.text: I visited this establishment at the recommendation from a friend as I was visiting the area and in search of soul food. This place did not disappoint! Everything was fresh and delicious! Will definitely be returning next time I'm in Charlotte!

j7o0Mu4DCE0KZCnoC_JtVw.text: Food was great. Got the dark chicken meal. Perfectly cooked chicken. Fried okra was on par with every other fried okra I've had at much more expensive restaurants. Service was good too. 100% worth the money if you're looking for some superb soul food.

Jy6tGldvuUesX5Nbz5kZZg.text: Whenever I'm in Charlotte I try to visit this spot. I normally get my food to go, but I decided to have Sunday dinner and dine in with some friends. The food didn't disappoint me. It was fast service and the food was very delicious, and The sweet tea was on point. The staff was professional as well. Keep up the great job.

Rc_yxv58KHrY1PapvLVdew.text: I ordered baked chicken with stuffing, mac and cheese, greens, candied yams, and cornbread all for $13!!!! It was so delicious! I do suggest calling ahead they can get pretty busy. If you do have to wait order an Arnold Palmer (sweet tea lemonade mix) it's also just as tasty!

aVaTwZMwMhQz5JfH7f6v8w.text: Awesome southern food! Great customer service!  GreAt location! Their Fried chicken is amazing as well as their sides!

msSg90t_N-FrOA8UEaS9zw.text: I heard how good the food was here and wanted to try it. But when i walked in and the first thing i saw was the cashers girl eating and chewing food and drinking a can of pop. So unprofessional.

YiRsH449tQD2U5Tj7q61lg.text: I ate there last night, ordered the fried gizzards snack with a roll. Lord them gizzards were the best I've ever had. They were  light, crispy & seasoned just right. My first time eating at the chicken box I arrived about ten minutes before closing so I was hoping the food wouldn't be rushed.  My only issue is they forgot my roll when I go back I'll ask for two.

BtFwhJgLEbuyfYr_9z04ng.text: Now, I don't know what food the other reviewers had... but it wasn't from this place . The mac and cheese was a disgrace. No flavor, unacceptable. The corn muffin was decent, but first bite I was disappointed. Fries were fries. I was craving some good ol fried chicken. The chicken was fried perfectly but lacked seasoning! It was edible, but with them not including hot sauce it's like eating fried crisp.

tTRO9hLn6fPksjREJmDvWw.text: Food is always good! People always friendly and great customer service! It's soul food meets home cooking here y'all ! When you have a taste for southern cooking come here !!!

yW73u671p6ZU8tAiU8zj7Q.text: I visited this restaurant yesterday with my family. We have visited on a few occasions and have catered for our church from this resturant, but yesterday will be the last visit here.  We arrived at 4pm..was not served until after 5. The waitress was overwhelmed because it was very busy...needed a refill on our drinks.....never saw her again after bringing our food one hour and 5 minutes later. My husband tried speaking with the owner,  but he pretty much ignored us, and we were polite. Supporting small business owners are essential and are key, but this experience is disheartening. Food was mediocre this time, as well.

_7CUTZGYLuKGKWmDBI6FYA.text: I have eaten here several times however I've always had it delivered via Postmates. Today I decided to stop in and pick my order up. When I called my order was taken quickly and with the kindness of someone speaking to an old friend, even though I've never met the individual that I was speaking to. I arrived and was met with a line of hungry guests which is understandable because it was right at lunch time and also served as a sign that I'm not go only one to find the food their delicious. The line moved quickly and I was greeted with kindness from everyone from the cashier, cooks in the kitchen and fellow guests. Their sign says "Miss the cooking your mom use to make?" Or something along those lines and It really is a down home place where you feel like a family member.  On to the food, I've only had their chicken but when I tell you it is HEAVENLY!!! Seasoned to perfection and fried so perfectly, it is SO good it makes you want to eat it all!! Even the damn bones and the parts of your fingers that the chicken juice has dropped on. Not to mention they have a very extensive menu of soul food favorites that I can wait to dig into. My only regret is that I wish that I had found this place sooner!!! Excellent work!!

EbSuT2FHJEwAKzieyvoCiw.text: Chicken was dry as all hell, Worst meatloaf I've ever eaten in my life, I kid you not, literal dog food drenched in ketchup and ketchup juice. Probably shouldn't have ordered meatloaf from a spot called Chicken Box. Where even the chicken they're supposedly known for is not even good. This was a terrible experience I'm laughing it off but we definitely won't be ordering from here again. Literally everything was disgusting.

zwpMMHvARirjyIrh0htF8Q.text: Ordered a fried Turkey it was $75.73 - what? It was only like 9lbs and btw, nothing else came with this, no sides no smiles. Nothing.  Never again.

ov1luYRfEkP-VCMF9ugHXg.text: A sold 4 stars for sure. Are with a table of people who ordered smothered pork chops, smothered chicken, chicken gizzard/liver plate. Mac n cheese, greens, yams, n a few other items. No pork used in the establishment for side items. Customer service was good. Good was fresh. Only complaint is that the smothered chicken is not the same as smothered pork chops as far as the way it were prepared. Lemonade was too good.

OyysmVRVQ7jgRYEsVBcVjg.text: I visited there today for the 2nd time. Customer service was poor and the the food doesn't make up for it. I had the fried chicken for twice and it's good, but nothing spectacular! I've also had the smothered pork chops with candied yams and macaroni and cheese. The Mac n cheese was HORRIBLE! It had a sour milk taste! The yams were straight out of the can! The pork chops were very tender and pretty flavorful. After visiting there twice I've seen enough to know that it's not worth the time or money.

Noov3bBLsEqiojdmHfV9ig.text: Best soul food in town. Me and my family have been going here for years! Keep up the good work chicken box!

Oy-5dmro2yR6h1MSk5UpeA.text: Not good at all. Fried chicken was salty. Took an hour to get food after ordering. Go to Merts don't waste your time.

8-gzpn41K9ZLwaM-1SdRXQ.text: We just wanted some good ole southern eats, some get in your belly soul food.  You walk in and place your order at a counter. The menu is big and on the wall. It being our first time, I wanted to try a little bit of everything so we ordered the following:  *Kids Meal with fish fillet and double side of mac and cheese *Gizzards *3 piece chicken wings *Smothered chicken with cabbage and green beans. *Smothered pork chop with greens and fried okra  We chose to dine in and so we sat our selves and waited for our food. And waited for our food. Then we waited a little bit more. Then they finally called our number. Everything came out looking delicious. But the key word here is "look". What made it so disappointing is that half of our food was cold. My pork chops were so cold in the middle and my hunny's chicken too. I didn't even eat my pork chop because it was too cold.   The mac and cheese was okay. The noodles were mushy and it was bland, it needed a little salt or something. The fish fillets were actually pretty good and we really enjoyed those.  The vegetables we had were alright. Fried okra was on point. It was hot and fresh and I just added a little bit of salt and it was so good. The other vegetable sides we had did not disappoint either but they did not wow our taste buds either.  The fried gizzards were banging. Perfectly fried and seasoned.  The fried chicken wings were on point too.   I actually liked the place. I should give them a two but what was good made up for what was bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smothered pork chops with fried okra and greens
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3piece chicken wings

sahWGqTBeVhVSMOIA75ctg.text: I've ordered food from this location several times, and the food is always delicious: the mac and cheese, yams, potato salad are on my list of favorites. My kids like the tilapia and pork chops.

5z-iAjBvHHWHCj8E7h26cA.text: I stopped here before my sons college visit. The food is awesome!! The service and decor not so much. It was my first time here and I walked in I thought I would have to wait for a hostess due to the layout but after seeing people order at the counter I just followed suit sine there was not a welcoming into the restaurant. I waited a few minutes to order. The person working counter seemed overwhelmed with walk-in and call in orders. The young man working the phone looked like he was a cook in the kitchen but trying to help out. The waitress fixed our drinks, gave them to us and just told us to find a seat. There's no direction on how service works. The lady helping us asked for ticket to see the order number. She was working the floor alone. We finally got our food and like I said very delicious but the dining room is much to be desired. Lighting is not good at all. Dark and the area behind us looked more like a catch all. I came to a conclusion that this may be a more take out place for the locals and I'll know next time. I will come back but only for takeout not dine in. Food- 4 stars, Decor - 2 stars, Service - 3 stars(because she was alone).

jR9GqCy_UD44j3iQvfi9Fg.text: I called in my order at 3 pm. I was told the order would be ready in 15 minutes. I ordered one veggie plate, one chicken dinner and one pork chop dinner. I arrive and have ti wait in line 15 minutes. Then was told they can't find my order. Then they find it. I pay and 45 minutes later, I am finally getting my order. Great food. Service needs improvement.

bw1BqnCxmVXd0pbL697Ocg.text: This was a hidden treat across the street from our hotel. Seems family run and very welcoming. We had a number of items in the menu. Fried chicken, Ox tails, fish, and more. The sides were great, especially the mac&cheese, greens, and yams. Definitely a welcomed addition to my list when in Charlotte. They have plenty of items on the menu including chitterlings and other southern favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 piece dark with greens and yams. About to go down in this piece. They treat you right here.

AP0sv79N4Kxjx5UxCHiqRw.text: I love it. Ate lunch here two days in row. Fried chicken was crispy good. Black eyed peas with rice and collard greens. Cornbread. Sweet tea was good. Fast delivery. Took out one day. Ate in the next. Waitress was good.

8SNUt6fn9XPYnmHnnVtpOQ.text: Not a lot of seats for the quest, the restaurant score is 84.5 their fried chicken is seasoned well n that's all I will say 4 now.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

RbKCaQzEOC0EVhvxyo7Itg.text: I've been here a few times, and the employees are always welcoming and the food is really good.  I would recommend the oxtails, fried chicken and the fried pork chops.   One plus is that if you eat inside, you will see all of the wall art that they have of prominent African Americans.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey wings with collards, macaroni and cornbread
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oxtails and rice with collards, macaroni and cornbread

oTHrQHNZSp17V_F7magOtA.text: Oh man, I've been a customer here for years now and just now gotten around to writing a review. Don't let the location fool you but this is one of the, if not, the best fried chicken in town!  I've read how the Gas Station Fried Chicken off South Blvd is the best but I beg to differ. The crispy skin and juicy meat here is one of the best I've ever had. The only thing holding me back from giving this a 5/5 are that the side dishes aren't as good. They taste bland without any seasoning on them. But definitely try the fried chicken here! You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 Piece Dinner w/ Fried Okra, Baked Mac n Cheese, and Corn Bread

SCohmogfv_XlptrnL07y5A.text: Tried about various entrees.  Fried chicken dinner is great.  OMG The OXTAILS please get them. Promise you won't be disappointed. I LOVED them. Trust and believe been to many places this place is a hidden Gem..  Seafood/Chicken dinner plate is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken/Seafood dinner plate. 5/5 everything is tasty and yummy...
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kick your Mama in the mouth. Best Oxtails so far.  Ohh love them

Qvkd3mZxaWlkMugXEAXcyw.text: Hubby and I was riding around looking for something near us to eat and this place popped up. I am so glad we decided to try it. It felt like home everyone was so nice and friendly. The sever was wonderful she made feel like my momma was checking on me while we were waiting on our food to be served. The lemonade was on point it went great with my fish. The mac and cheese was made from scratch and baked too. You get your money's worth for the food so I will be back again soon. If you looking for some good soul food in Charlotte check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

8DmP2zZfcSHjwKdMnxyN-Q.text: Three of us dined here for a late lunch on a beautiful Saturday afternoon. My daughter highly suggested we try this place and I'm so glad she did! Every bite I had was full of flavor and so delicious. There are so many options, it was hard to choose, but I enjoyed everything I chose and can't wait to go back. The staff is very friendly and so attentive. You order at the register upon entering and then you can choose where you want to sit and they bring your meal to you at your table. There's a small wait for your food, but it's worth the wait, the food is freshly prepared while you wait. My daughter and I both had the fried chicken and fish combo, which comes with two delicious sides. My daughters friend had the fish and fried shrimp combo. We all had different sides, collard greens, cabbage, mac and cheese, potato salad and candied yams. We each enjoyed every bite and couldn't stop talking about it. We each had leftovers that were still good later.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

wFVbve-fOHDQ63i_7no5Ww.text: This place reminds me of family style restaurants back home in GA. I love all of the artwork on the walls. The staff was great and took good care of me. I enjoyed the food and will definitely be back for some more southern cooking. I only dropped in for a snack but I could see coming back for Sunday dinner. See you soon!

6qDoTwgM3h62jjYCB4hFEQ.text: Hadn't been to the Chicken Box since they were on Tryon so I thought I try this location out. The wait was extremely long for the food to come out. The customer service was good, however it was a little unprofessional. The women working the cash registers were nice, but they talked negatively about other employees the entire time I was there. Very unprofessional. I ordered the Wing snack and Salisbury steak with dressing and mashed potatoes. (I hadn't eaten all day) the wings were really good. The Salisbury steak was horrible however. The dressing was also terrible. I did like the mashed potatoes though. I had a lemonade while I was there and it was good. If I'm ever in the area again, I'd stop by and just order the chicken.

uXzMaoG6cBUmypYJY1ntFQ.text: If you love southern style home cooked soul food this is your spot. Its not the most modern but it gets the job done. Three stars were given because I waited over an hour for one plate of food and when asking a cashier about your food their attitude weren't the most pleasant.

DlVVDh5cFxBj5H6n43cHGw.text: Horrible services!! Oredereddine in and they ordered me take out. Then told me to sit and kisten to my name instead of fixing it. Got a side irder of coleslaw and the put inside my cheeseburger. Spoke to a mngr whom was completely dismissive and left me standing at the counter by myself and didn't care what i had to say!

qvvCs8zYBwr38iuLBcedQw.text: My first visit here on Sunday Feb 10, 2019. Mind you it is a Sunday , sorta crowded. Most of the tables were not cleaned off, no where to sit or stand. Ordered our food then found a clean booth to sit it. Food is already cooked except the fish. It took 30 minutes to get our food. They only had 2 waitresses that couldn't keep up, older ladies. The service here sucks along with the personality. I can say the food was good but wasn't worth the headache with the wait staff. Make sure you get everything you need at one time . It takes forever for them to come back to your table. I may give them another chance

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smothered pork chops
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meatloaf
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey wings

8s5oSeDsR0oq7njuG4CGvA.text: How did this happen,  this is my second time here and it seems like I am fan. Well I am. This time I  brought someone with me just to see if I am not losing my mind on how good the gizzards were. I ordered the oxtail and spicy gumbo but my wife tried the gizzards and liver. Food was as good as I thought. The oxtail was good the meat fell off the bone. I will  be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oxtail and gumbo
Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mmmmmmmm

DJbnBjOy9NK7WNWxnxkuzw.text: Love the food, quick services.  Just wish they updated the flooring or do a professional deep cleaning to make a better appearance . But the service and food is consistently excellent!

FgmezhMHPuumb2JGLK_MmA.text: From the cashiers to the cooks they keep me coming back. The foid is always hot and fresh.

BMOlutaFmVmhR6d4WNB7aQ.text: By far my fav soul food restaurant in QC! I love the authenticity and atmosphere. Feels like home and some place that you'd find in any city. The fried chicken is DELICIOUS and I haven't had a side I did not like. The Mac and cheese is perfect and the greens are divine. Also a special shout out to the cabbage. They do make a mean smothered pork chop. The gravy is seasoned perfectly and the pork chop was spot on. The staff is friendly and engaging however I can see how some folks might feel different. For some of us, we get it because we grew up in the culture and for me as a transplant, I feel right at home at the Chicken Box!

LVy-Lc4oCUZYhsaCGSUXpQ.text: I got a 3pc fish, Mac & cheese with yams!!! It was really good. If you check-in on Yelp you get a free drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3pc fish, Mac &amp; cheese with yams!!! It was really good. If you check-in on Yelp you get a free drink.

3ZqMoUTAbxZO5oMPN33WZg.text: This was my 3rd time eating here and they never disappoints. It's definitely not the nicest looking restaurant on the outside but the food makes up for that. This time I got the 2pc fried chicken dinner with macaroni and cheese and candied yams. The fried chicken is always crispy and tender. Some of the BEST fried chicken in town. The macaroni and cheese was very flavorful as well. However, I was not very impressed with the candied yams. Next time, I will stick with the fries which are well seasoned. The Sweet Tea was BOMB and just how I like it (I prefer my tea very sweet).   The service is pretty good. Every time I order, it takes no more than 10 mins for my order to finish.   I would definitely recommend this place. I can ensure that you won't be disappointed. Thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2pc Fried Chicken dinner with Macaroni and Cheese and Candied Yams

oyp3uaTBKOzEbCIUvWSjTw.text: This was my first time although I've  lived here for over 10 years but I wanted some "home cooking" on my lunch break. I called my order in ahead and the service was great both in person and over the phone surprisingly for Saturday's lunch hr. I forgot to check in for my free tea but the foods great and my order was ready I was in and out and they were busy with a line so I'm very pleased and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Box Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smothered Pork chops over rice with collard greens potato salad and cornbread

3_VdSU2yeSQfX0A9rS7fYg.text: This is my first time at the new location. So yea, the last time I had chicken box was apparently 5 years ago!  I got the two piece dark meat dinner that came with 3 sides. The sides are "okay." The real VIP here is the chicken. I wish I went with the 3 piece dinner for a buck more instead. Learn from my mistake guys!  The chicken is most akin to Popeyes. It's delicious, but not as salty as bojangles breading. Give it a try yourself!

cvqW5hK0cdWuqFED-9DQpg.text: My sister and I were on the road traveling and really wanted some soul food.  We decided to stop here based on the yelp reviews.  We ordered take out.  The service was good.  I felt that the food was priced appropriately.  The portion size was average.  We ordered fried whiting, fried and baked chicken, and chitterlings for entrees.  We enjoyed the fish and chicken very much.  My sister said the chitterlings were just ok but if visiting again she wouldn't order them.  We had Mac and cheese, greens, yams, and green beans.  We enjoyed all of the sides.  We had a 30 minute drive to our destination and the food was still warm  upon our arrival.  We shared with others and still had a few leftovers.  I would go back given the opportunity.

stk5zW9b68C-6dTJ0dHnIA.text: I'm here visiting in Charlotte North Carolina stopping in one of the local soul food restaurant the decor is a real pretty with a lot of lovely artwork and the staff was very friendly. The Food was delicious we had a smothered porkchops and oxtails.
